intro: Macleania alata, commonly known as the silverleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves that reflect light, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its unique foliage and delicate blooms make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens.
